entry.title: Optimized Product Quantization for Approximate Nearest Neighbor Search
entry.content:
Overview

Space decomposition has been shown to have great impact on the search accuracy in Product-Quantiztion. In this paper, we optimize product quantization by minimizing quantization distortions with respect to the space decomposition and the quantization codebooks.

Details

Vector Distortion

  Vector quantization maps a vector x∈RDx\in R^{D}x∈RD to a codeword ccc in a codebook C={c(i)}C=\{c(i)\}C={c(i)} with i in a finite index set, where the function i(⋅)i(·)i(⋅) is called an encoder, and the function c(⋅)c(·)c(⋅) is called a decoder.
  The quantization distortion E is defined as:

E=1n∑x∥x−c(i(x))∥2E = \frac{1}{n} \sum_{\mathbf{x}} \|\mathbf{x} - \mathbf{c}(i(\mathbf{x}))\|^2E=n1​x∑​∥x−c(i(x))∥2

  where ∣∣⋅∣∣||·||∣∣⋅∣∣ denotes the l2−norml_{2}-norml2​−norm, n is the total number of data samples, and the summation is over all the points in the given sample set.
  Product quantization involves decomposing the D-dimensional vector space into M subspaces, and computing a sub-codebook for each subspace. M is determined by the budget constraint of memory space and the computational cost, and is predertermined in practice. We use an orthonnormal matrix R to represent the space decomposition by which the D-dimensional vector space is first transformed.
  Therefore, the free parameters of product quantization consist of sub-codebooks for the subspaces and the matrix R. We optimize product quantization to minimize distortion over these free paramenters:

min⁡R,C1,…,CM∑x∥x−c(i(x))∥2,(4)\min_{R,\mathbf{C}^1,\ldots,\mathbf{C}^M} \sum_{\mathbf{x}} \|\mathbf{x} - \mathbf{c}(i(\mathbf{x}))\|^2, \quad (4) \\R,C1,…,CMmin​x∑​∥x−c(i(x))∥2,(4)

s.t. c∈C={c∣Rc∈C1×…×CM, RTR=I}s.t.\ \mathbf{c} \in \mathcal{C} = \{\mathbf{c} \mid R\mathbf{c} \in \mathbf{C}^1 \times \ldots \times \mathbf{C}^M, \ R^{\mathrm{T}}R = I\}s.t. c∈C={c∣Rc∈C1×…×CM, RTR=I}

A Non-Parameter Solution

基本思想：无需假设数据分布，交替优化空间分解矩阵 R 和子码本
算法步骤：

  1. 随机初始化 R、子码本Cm{C^{m}}Cm、各个向量的索引im{i^{m}}im
  2. 固定 R 优化码本：将数据投影到 R 空间，对每个子空间独立运行 k-means 聚类，更新子码本
  3. 固定码本优化 R：将数据投影到当前子码本空间，通过正交普鲁克问题(Orthogonal Procrustes problem) 求解最优 R
  4. 重复步骤2-3，直到算法收敛

A Parametric Solution

Our parametric solution first computes the covariance matrix ∑\sum∑ of the data and use Eigenvalue Allocation to generate the orthonnormal matrix R,which determines the space decomposition. The data are then transformed by R. The original PQ algorithm is then performed on these transformed data.

基本思想：假设数据服从高斯分布，通过特征值分配平衡子空间的方差，最小化理论失真下界。
算法步骤：

  1. PCA对齐：对数据进行PCA变换，使各个维度独立
  2. 特征值排序：将特征值降序排序
  3. 特征值分配：将特征值依次分配到 M 个子空间，每个子空间包含D/MD/MD/M个特征值，确保各子空间的特征值乘积均衡(Sequentially pick out the largest eigenvalue and allocate it to the bucket having the minimum product of the eigenvalues in it unless the bucket is full)
  4. 生成空间分解矩阵 R：根据分配的特征值对应的主成分方向构建 R(The principle directions corresponding to the eigenvalues in each bucket form the subspace)

References

entry.title: Product quantization for nearest neighbor search
entry.content:
Overview

The idea is to decompose the space into a Cartesian product of low dimensional subspaces and to quantize each subspace separately. A vector is represented by a short code composed of its subspace quantization indices

Details

Vector quantization

Quantization is a destructive process whose purpose is to reduce the cardinality of the representation space. Formally, a quantizer is a function q mapping a D-dimensional vector x∈RDx\in R^{D}x∈RD to a vector q(x)∈C={ci;i∈T}q(x)\in C=\{c_i;i\in T\}q(x)∈C={ci​;i∈T}, where the index set T is to be finite: T=0...k−1T=0...k-1T=0...k−1. The reproduction values cic_{i}ci​ are called centroids. The set of reproduction values C is the codebook of size k.
The set ViV_{i}Vi​ of vectors mapped to a given index i is rederred to a (Voronoi) cell and defined as: Vi≜{x∈RD:q(x)=ci}V_i \triangleq \{x \in \mathbb{R}^D : q(x) = c_i\}Vi​≜{x∈RD:q(x)=ci​}

Product quantizers

motivation

Let us consider a 128-dimensional vector, a quantizer producing 64-bits codes will actually contain k=264k=2^{64}k=264 centroids. Howerver, it’s impossible to use Lloyd’s algorithm or even HKM, as the number of samples required and the complexity of learning the quantizer are serveral times k. It’s also impossible to store the D×kD\times kD×k floating point values representing the k centroids.

methodology

in PQ,the input vector xxx is split into m distinct subvectors uju_{j}uj​, and the subvectors are quantized separately using m distinct quantizers:

search with quantizaion

the artical proposed two methos:

  1. Symmetric distance computation(SDC):both the query-vector x and database vector y are represented by their respective centroids q(x) and q(y)
  2. Asymetric distance computation(ADC):the database vector y is represented by q(y), but the query vector is not encoded

(usually ADC is preferred for accuracy. And we will use a pre-calculated distcance lookup table for accerlation [ref-2 for detail] )

IVF-PQ/IVF-ADC

To avoid exhaustive neighbor search, this method combines an inverted file system with the ADC, which allows rapid access to a small fraction of possible database vectors:

  • firstly, a codebook is learned using k-means, producing a quantizer qcq_{c}qc​ referred to as the coarse quantizer. It is used to determine which inverted list a databsed vector belongs to
  • in addition to the coarse quantizer, the description of a vector yyy is refined by a code obtained with a product quantizer which quantizes the residual vector of the original vector: r(y)=y−qc(y)r(y)=y-q_{c}(y)r(y)=y−qc​(y)
  • usually, we will probe multiple invertd lists instead of one when find the nearest neighbor of a query vetor to improve accuracy

References

  1. JÉGOU H, DOUZE M, SCHMID C. Product Quantization for Nearest Neighbor Search[J]. IEEE Transactions on Pattern Analysis and Machine Intelligence, 2011, 33(1): 117-128.
  2. Towards data sicence: Product Quantization for similarity Search

entry.title: Billion-Scale Similarity Search Using a Hybrid Indexing Approach with Advanced Filtering
entry.content:
Overview

Our approach extends the classical IVF-FLAT structure by introduction hybrid vectors that integrate dense embeddings and discrete filtering attributes.

对于向量数据和标量数据的混合过滤检索，一般会将标量数据和向量数据分开存储和索引，然后在混合检索时候采用 pre-filtering 或 post-filtering 处理策略。
本文提出了一种混合索引方案，将标量数据转化后得到的 Attribute Vector, 和向量原数据 Core Vector 拼接形成 Hybrid Vector 进行统一存储和索引。

Detail

Concepts

  • Core Vector: The orignal, raw, high-dimensional vector representation of the data point
  • Attribute Vector: Represents the discrete filtering attributes assiciated with each data point
  • Hybrid Vector: The concatenation of the core vector and the attribute vector
  • Query Vector: Represents the search query,which is also a hybrid vector, a result from the concatenation from the core search vector and the search filtering attributes

The Attribute vectors are generated to simulate realistic metadata while mataining a controlled environment. Each dimension of the attribute vector is assigned a random integer value drawn from a uniform distribution.

Hybrid Index Construction

混合索引的结构整体上继承了 IVF-FLAT 的思想，通过 K-Means / MiniBatchKMeans 聚类得到 K 个聚类中心后，根据每个 Hybrid Vector 的 Core Vector 部分与聚类中心的距离，将拼接后的混合向量存进与之最近的聚类中心对应的的链表中

Search

Query Vector(qh=[xinput∣∣ainput]q_h=[x_{input} || a_{input}]qh​=[xinput​∣∣ainput​])

  1. 根据混合查询向量中的原始向量 xinputx_{input}xinput​ 部分选出索引中与之最相近的 T 个聚类中心（所有聚类中心保留在内存中）
  2. 从磁盘加载 T 个聚类中心对应的链表进内存，根据混合向量中的属性向量 ainputa_{input}ainput​ 部分过滤掉不和要求的若干向量（按需将链表加载进入内存，降低内存开销）
  3. 对于过滤后得到的每个向量，计算其原始 Core Vector 部分和 xinputx_{input}xinput​ 之间的距离。最后归并得到 top-K 个相似的向量结果

Future Directions

  1. disk-based storage strategy with intelligent caching
  2. adapative methods for determing K and T based on dataset characteristics, query patterns, and filter selectivity
  3. parallel / distributed access improvements
  4. attribute compression methos

Reference

  • EMANUILOV S, DIMOV A. Billion-Scale Similarity Search Using a Hybrid Indexing Approach with Advanced Filtering[J]. Cybernetics and Information Technologies, 2024, 24(4): 45-58.
